intro: Ophiorrhiziphyllon, commonly known as the leafy ophiorrhiza, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Rubiaceae. These plants are characterized by their simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. They are typically found in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, shaded environments. The genus includes several species that are sometimes used in traditional medicine. Ophiorrhiziphyllon species are also known for their ability to thrive in nutrient-poor soils.
